meanings.definition: To cut off the top or outer parts of (something)
meanings.sent1: She was cropping the overgrown bushes in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was cropping the wheat in the field.
meanings.sent3: The barber accidentally kept cropping the customer's hair shorter than requested.
meanings.sent4: The chef swiftly cropped the vegetables for the stir-fry dish.
meanings.sent5: The tailor carefully cropped the fabric to make a perfect fit.

meanings.definition: To select and remove unwanted parts from (a photograph)
meanings.sent1: She spent hours cropping the family photo to remove the strangers in the background.
meanings.sent2: The photographer cropped the image to focus on the subject's smile.
meanings.sent3: The artist playfully cropped the picture, making everyone look like they had funny hats.
meanings.sent4: The editor cropped the photo to highlight the stunning sunset in the background.
meanings.sent5: The student cropped the picture for the school project, removing distractions.

meanings.definition: The action of cutting off the top or outer parts of something
meanings.sent1: The cropping of the tree branches allowed more sunlight to reach the garden.
meanings.sent2: The cropping of the cake made it easier to serve to the guests.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected cropping of the hedge by the neighbor led to a unique garden design.
meanings.sent4: The sudden cropping of the conversation left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The precise cropping of the fabric ensured a perfect fit for the dress.
